title: PC running out of RAM when building Pytorch from source
body_html:
OS: Manjaro Linux 17.1.5 64bit
CPU: Intel Pentium P6000, 1.87Gh x 2
RAM: 3.66 (4 Gb)
GPU: None
GCC: gcc (GCC) 7.3.0

When installing Pytorch from source I've ran out of RAM and computer freezes. I need to install Pytorch from source because I can't run any script because it raises the "Illegal instruction (core dumped)" error.
I can't tell you more than this because everytime I've ran the commands to install Pytorch, my PC froze and I had to restart the computer by pressing the button.

This is what I did to install Pytorch from source:

  • git clone --recursive https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch
  • export CMAKE_PREFIX_PATH="/home/crow/anaconda3/"
  • export NO_CUDA=1
  • python setup.py install

What should I do to install Pytorch?
body_text:
OS: Manjaro Linux 17.1.5 64bit
CPU: Intel Pentium P6000, 1.87Gh x 2
RAM: 3.66 (4 Gb)
GPU: None
GCC: gcc (GCC) 7.3.0
When installing Pytorch from source I've ran out of RAM and computer freezes. I need to install Pytorch from source because I can't run any script because it raises the "Illegal instruction (core dumped)" error.
I can't tell you more than this because everytime I've ran the commands to install Pytorch, my PC froze and I had to restart the computer by pressing the button.
This is what I did to install Pytorch from source:

git clone --recursive https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch
export CMAKE_PREFIX_PATH="/home/crow/anaconda3/"
export NO_CUDA=1
python setup.py install

What should I do to install Pytorch?
body:
OS: Manjaro Linux 17.1.5 64bit
CPU: Intel Pentium P6000, 1.87Gh x 2
RAM: 3.66 (4 Gb)
GPU: None
GCC: gcc (GCC) 7.3.0

When installing Pytorch from source I've ran out of RAM and computer freezes. I need to install Pytorch from source because I can't run any script because it raises the "Illegal instruction (core dumped)" error.
I can't tell you more than this because everytime I've ran the commands to install Pytorch, my PC froze and I had to restart the computer by pressing the button.

This is what I did to install Pytorch from source:
- git clone --recursive https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch
- export CMAKE_PREFIX_PATH="/home/crow/anaconda3/"
- export NO_CUDA=1
- python setup.py install

What should I do to install Pytorch?
